text: Steve Thomas Lacy-Moya (born May 23, 1998) is an American singer, songwriter, guitar player, and music producer. He became popular for being the guitar player for the Internet, an alternative R&B; band. He started his career in music by doing production work for other artists. Then, In 2017, he started making music by himself. He released an extended play (EP) named Steve Lacy's Demo. After this, he worked with other music makers, such as Kendrick Lamar, Solange, Frank Ocean, Calvin Harris, and Tyler, the Creator. His first studio album was released in 2019. It is named Apollo XXI. It was nominated for a Grammy Award. It went onto the Billboard 200 music chart. His second studio album is named Gemini Rights. It was released in 2022. The album had a single named "Bad Habit". It was Lacy's first single to go to the number one spot on the Billboard Hot 100. The song was very popular on social media websites, such as TikTok. He won a Grammy Award for the album. == References == == Other websites == * Steve Lacy on SoundCloud Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:LGBT musicians Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:LGBT African-Americans Category:American guitarists
title: Steve Lacy (singer)
